The Early Childhood Education (ECE) program at Toronto Metropolitan University prepares graduates for positions as Registered Early Childhood Educators (RECEs) in full-day early learning programs. They will be prepared to guide and lead curriculum and pedagogy in various early childhood settings such as child care centres, family drop-in programs, early intervention services, family support programs, and Emerging Best Start Child and Family Centres.

Graduates with a previous ECE degree who wish to pursue further education have successfully gained admission to master's degree programs and/or the faculty of education at notable universities, including Toronto Metropolitan University's Master of Arts in Early Childhood Studies.

- ECL 2102: Applied Research Methods
- ECL 3101: Quality Assurance for Early Childhood Programs
- ECL 3102: Leadership in Learning Organizations
- ECL 3103: Leadership in a Technological World
- ECL 3201: Human Development: Current Topics
- ECL 3202: Building Healthy Communities: Advocacy and Leadership
- ECL 3205: Internship Seminar
- ECL 4102: Curriculum Leadership in Early Learning and Care
- ECL 4103: Managing Projects as an Early Childhood Leader

Students are required to complete a third-year internship, which is a 14-week work experience in an early childhood program, a related child and family service, or a relevant government department. Internships may be local, elsewhere in Canada, or in an international setting.

Relevant post-graduate study opportunities offered by Toronto Metropolitan University include the Master of Arts in Early Childhood Studies.
